Depois de fritar minha cabe√ßa nesse jogo acabei esquecendo a senha do meu celular...

This is what happens when Redditors who follow "I LOVE SCIENCE" and Neil DeGrasse Tyson pages on Facebook decide to make a video game. The puzzles aren't exactly rocket science (you know, actual science) and while they can be enjoyable, that's only when the rest of the game shuts up. Unbearable, unfunny, and dated. Hopefully Valve won't let this be their single player swan song.

Its a nice game. Puzzles are not all just a walk through 2min things. Story line is good. (You don't need to play portal one to understand this.) For 2011 the games graphics have not aged that badly. Also got it for the price of a can of coke.
One of the best games I have ever played, and as of writing this it's 99 cents. Absolutely buy it.

I got this game for $1 and it was worth the money, the game took me almost 8 hours to beat. I beat it at 3 am which wasn't such a good idea because every puzzle made my brain hurt that far into the game. 7.5/10
Very good game with good story! Everyone can play it, and enjoy while playing it! Story is not too long, but it is not too short!   1 of my favorite games in steam!

Best game I've ever played. It's worth the price. Good storyline, great voice acting, humor (dark humor sometimes as well). Fun puzzles that make you think with portals. Graphics... well, 2011, you can't except extreme level of detail. But it still looks good. I personally like the futuristic laboratory theme.
Very engaging game both in the storyline and in the game itself, I would highly recomend it.
